closed_reason: Listed all subcommands from cmd/ticker/main.go: run (epic execution with TUI/headless), resume (checkpoint recovery), checkpoints (list saved states), upgrade (self-update). Read-only task, no code changes.
description: Read cmd/ticker/main.go and list all subcommands defined.

run.output:
I'll start by reading the epic notes and then complete the current task of listing CLI commands from cmd/ticker/main.go.

Let me read the main.go file to identify all subcommands defined.

I've read the file. Now I can identify all the CLI subcommands defined in cmd/ticker/main.go.

Based on my analysis, here are the subcommands defined:

**CLI Subcommands in cmd/ticker/main.go:**

1. **`run`** (line 53-75) - Run one or more epics with the AI agent
   - Flags: `--max-iterations/-n`, `--max-cost`, `--checkpoint-interval`, `--max-task-retries`, `--auto`, `--headless`, `--jsonl`, `--skip-verify`, `--verify-only`, `--worktree`, `--parallel`

2. **`resume`** (line 77-85) - Resume from a checkpoint
   - Args: `<checkpoint-id>` (exactly 1 required)

3. **`checkpoints`** (line 87-96) - List available checkpoints
   - Args: `[epic-id]` (optional, max 1)

4. **`upgrade`** (line 98-129) - Upgrade ticker to the latest version

The root command `ticker` (line 38-51) itself can also be run without subcommands to show interactive epic picker (TUI mode).

Now let me close the task with the solution summary.

Task completed. I identified 4 CLI subcommands in cmd/ticker/main.go:

1. **`run`** - Run epics with the AI agent (supports TUI, headless, parallel execution)
2. **`resume`** - Resume from a saved checkpoint  
3. **`checkpoints`** - List available checkpoints
4. **`upgrade`** - Upgrade ticker to latest version

This was a read-only task requiring no code changes, so no commit was needed.

title: List CLI commands
